p: Large‐seeded species are expected to have higher post‐dispersal predation than small‐seeded species (Blate, Peart, & Leighton, 1998; Janzen, 1971) and thus should germinate promptly to avoid risks of mortality. Conversely, small‐seeded species are expected to delay germination and thus be persistent in the soil seed bank (Rees, 1994; Venable & Brown, 1988). Empirical data support this prediction for grasslands (Grime, Mason, Curtis, Rodman, & Band, 1981), but no conclusive evidence for it has been found in other temperate environments (Moles & Westoby, 2010; Leishman & Westoby, 1994).
